metadata.Title: CVE-2018-4300 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The session cookie generated by the CUPS web interface was easy to guess on Linux, allowing unauthorized scripted access to the web interface when the web interface is enabled. This issue affected versions prior to v2.2.10.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-4300` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.2
cups-bsd - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.2
cups-client - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.2
cups-common - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.2
cups-core-drivers - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.2
cups-daemon - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.2
cups-ipp-utils - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.2
cups-ppdc - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.2
cups-server-common - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.2
libcups2 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.2
libcupscgi1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.2
libcupsimage2 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.2
libcupsmime1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.2
libcupsppdc1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Updates for this issue were originally assigned CVE-2018-4700, which was a typo and got rejected.

criterions.comment: cups package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.7-1ubuntu2.2').
